meanings.definition: Relating to, containing, or derived from humus.
meanings.sent1: The humic soil was rich and dark, perfect for growing vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The farmer added humic substances to improve the quality of the soil.
meanings.sent3: The humic compost made the plants grow so well, they started dancing!
meanings.sent4: Her garden flourished like a jungle, thanks to the humic nutrients in the soil.
meanings.sent5: The earthy smell of the humic soil reminded her of a forest after rain.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the organic component of soil.
meanings.sent1: The humic layer of the soil was teeming with life.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the humic substances to understand soil fertility.
meanings.sent3: The worms in the humic soil threw a party for the ants.
meanings.sent4: The humic richness of the earth embraced the roots of the plants.
meanings.sent5: The humic content of the soil was like a hidden treasure for the plants.
